alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 4:15AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Grady, southeastern Oklahoma, Cleveland and McClain Counties through 500 AM CST... At 415 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to near Dibble to 3 miles southwest of Alex. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Blanchard, Purcell, Choctaw, Noble, Tuttle, Harrah, Slaughterville, Spencer, Jones, Nicoma Park, Lexington, Goldsby, Dibble and Valley Brook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 92 and 126. Interstate 40 between mile markers 154 and 173. Interstate 44 between mile markers 91 and 115. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
